WRITING.TEXT:
D.h. jeglicher Kommentar und jegliche Kritik an der Verunstaltung des Stadtbildes durch solchen *corporate vandalism* ist ein Zugestndnis an die Werbebranche?
Ausschlielich Fressehalten und versuchen, es irgendwie zu ignorieren, wenn die eigene Strae zum Times Square verkommt, ist legitim?

Die [Kampagne](http://www.adweek.com/brand-marketing/mercedes-benzs-most-ambitious-marketing-project-yet-is-all-about-what-it-means-to-grow-up/) fordert, dass man "erwachsen werden" muss und listet dabei einen Haufen Charakterattribute und Lifestyle-Entscheidungen, welche mit diesem "Erwachsensein" angeblich einhergehen.
Und suggeriert natrlich, dass solche "Erwachsenen" dann Mercedes fahren.
Es ist sehr wohl eine Provokation der 'Mentalitt der Berliner' (auch wenn die Kampagne nicht speziell fr Berlin gemacht wurde) - um damit dann auf ihre Marke hinzuweisen.
Viel mehr als die primitive Kampagne selbst stre ich mich allerdings an der Verunstaltung des Stadtbildes durch solche Werbung.
In den Worten von Baksy:
People are taking the piss out of you every day. They butt into your life, take a cheap shot at you and then disappear. They leer at you from tall buildings and make you feel small. They make flippant comments from buses that imply youre not sexy enough and that all the fun is happening somewhere else. They are on TV making your girlfriend feel inadequate. They have access to the most sophisticated technology the world has ever seen and they bully you with it. They are The Advertisers and they are laughing at you.
You, however, are forbidden to touch them. Trademarks, intellectual property rights and copyright law mean advertisers can say what they like wherever they like with total impunity.
Fuck that. Any advert in a public space that gives you no choice whether you see it or not is yours. Its yours to take, re-arrange and re-use. You can do whatever you like with it. Asking for permission is like asking to keep a rock someone just threw at your head.
You owe the companies nothing. Less than nothing, you especially dont owe them any courtesy. They owe you. They have re-arranged the world to put themselves in front of you. They never asked for your permission, dont even start asking for theirs.

Mercedes is plastering building facades in Berlin with the slogan of their new [campaign](http://www.adweek.com/brand-marketing/mercedes-benzs-most-ambitious-marketing-project-yet-is-all-about-what-it-means-to-grow-up/).
Makes me want to reply: *Advertiser. It's time to go fuck yourself.*

Sie knnen, wenn sie wollen.
Sie wollen nur zu oft nicht.
*whistles

WRITING.TEXT: I don't see where this video claims at all that *'Europe never had any problems with populists and the radical right'*.

I really appriciate a foreigner educating me on what my political options and opinions should be.
Discussing politics across national borders is a positive thing, wouldn't you say? Not only in Europe but *especially* in Europe.
Your post sounds a bit defensive to be honest. Nobody in the video said you're MegaHitler for voting for Wilders - all the video does is encourage people to get informed (which many people did *not* do sufficiently before Brexit and Trump's election) and go vote.

weinend sich aus diesem Bund.

Das ist eine **[offizielle Microsoft-Werbung](http://www.indiatimes.com/lifestyle/technology/microsoft-thinks-you-want-to-work-24-hour-days-the-internet-disagrees-232227.html)**.

Reminds me of **[this one](https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-RA9Q1MaBidY/UQGXrShqhzI/AAAAAAAAJVE/Lr7CVczdvc0/s1600/streetart-berlin11.jpg)** in Kpenicker Str. in Berlin, depicting the fall of the Berlin wall - and its re-erection through other means.

WRITING.TITLE: Bryan Cranston and Louis CK in Trumbo's "You Live Like a Rich Guy" scene

WRITING.TEXT:
Yeah, the English one is a bit too focused on *cult of personality* ("You're the greatest mind evaaar! You're a genius!"), as English-speaking 'hero' stories tend to be.
The German trailer seems more focused on the actual content of his work.
Yeah, I don't expect it to break any box office records.

Ich verstehe, was Du meinst, wrde das ganze aber etwas differenzierter betrachten. Mit dem Totschlagargument der Heuchlerei knnte man auch jedes Buch, jeden Film und berhaupt jeglichen kulturellen Beitrag zu Marx/Kommunismus/Sozialismus verurteilen, der in unserem kapitalistischen System erschaffen wird.
Da wir nunmal im Kapitalismus leben, ist es de facto unmglich, einen Film zu machen, der ein "kapitalismusfrei"-Label verdienen wrde.
Wie wertvoll oder kontraproduktiv (Stichwort "Ruhigstellung der Massen") ich denk Film finde, werde ich anhand seines Inhaltes beurteilen, wenn ich ihn nchste Woche sehe.
Haven't seen it myself yet but will try to catch it in the cinema next week.

WRITING.TEXT: **[Ugh, I'm so busy](https://www.theatlantic.com/business/archive/2017/03/busyness-status-symbol/518178/)**
I preferred the [German trailer](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JL0UtVcEUa4) but here's an opportunity for international Reddit to become familiar with this movie, for those interested.

I've always seen this meme used sarcastically.
This here seems like it's taking the piss out of stances I actually agree with.

Agreed. I was intrigued by Mr. robot mainly for the 'political' thriller storyline in the first season. In the second season, they mostly focused on the personal character gimmick of 'what is or isn't real' - which was getting rather boring to me.
It just doesn't carry more than a couple of hours.

I don't think his remarkable skills as a visual director mean that he'd be a great screenwriter. Not sure letting him do rewrites would actually serve the movies that much. They need to get great writers on board.

I think it's worth having a look at the **[German election system](http://www.spiegel.de/international/germany/german-election-system-explained-a-923243.html)**.
It's said to be "complicated but about the fairest system around", but frankly I don't even think it's *that* complicated compared to the US election system.

Got any links to those *much better people* talking about this topic?
I'd be interested.

The point is that having a low attention span will *make you* think any video is 'boring' and 'way too long' more likely.
What are those ways to use Facebook and Twitter without falling into instant gratification moments? It seems to me that those incentives are too fundamentally built into both those websites' design.

The Differences between Blender and Bforartists

WRITING.TEXT:
Autodesk is forcing everyone to subscriptions. Read the article linked in the tweet.
Also, this one: https://twitter.com/ChrisOffner3D/status/839747672659623937 People were told they could keep their perpetual license with maintenance... that's now proven to have been a lie.
They're cancelling the maintenance plan and forcing everyone on subscription. Even though in September they said this: https://twitter.com/ChrisOffner3D/status/839747672659623937
MODO is still their best offering in terms of price/performance as well as licensing, but they're trying to change that as well.
Great move, congratulations! More of us need to show them that screwing over their user base will actually show up negatively rather than positively on their bottom line.

The Foundry will likely follow suit soon.
People are discussing on their forums here: https://community.foundry.com/discuss/topic/129948/autodesk-pushing-everyone-into-rental
Looks like the future is with privately held companies (Pixologic, SideFX) and open source (Blender) who treat their customers fairly instead of corporate vultures like Autodesk and The Foundry.
